      function OptanonWrapper() {
        var user = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('userDetails')) || {};
        const id = user.id ? user.id : window['pendo'].get_visitor_id();
        const firstName = user.first_name;
        const lastName = user.last_name;
        let targetingCookieValue;
        let dnpValue;
        const dataLayer = window.dataLayer;
        const GroupsArr = dataLayer?.filter((item) => item.event === 'OneTrustGroupsUpdated');
        console.log(window.dataLayer);
        if (GroupsArr?.length > 1) {
          const previousCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 2]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          const updatedCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 1]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          let FunctionalCategoryChanged;
          let TargetingCategoryChanged;
          const previousCLC003Exist = previousCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') > -1;
          const updatedCLC003Exist = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') > -1;
          if (previousCLC003Exist && !updatedCLC003Exist) {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = true;
            dnpValue = true;
          } else if (!previousCLC003Exist && updatedCLC003Exist) {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = true;
            dnpValue = false;
          } else {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = false;
          }

          const previousCLC004Exist = previousCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') > -1;
          const updatedCLC004Exist = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') > -1;
          if (previousCLC004Exist && !updatedCLC004Exist) {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = true;
            targetingCookieValue = 'NO';
          } else if (!previousCLC004Exist && updatedCLC004Exist) {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = true;
            targetingCookieValue = 'YES';
          } else {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = false;
          }

          if (FunctionalCategoryChanged) {
            callDNP(id, dnpValue, user.session);
          } else if (updatedCLC003Exist) {
            console.log('0003 on');
            initializePendo();
          }
          if (TargetingCategoryChanged) {
            /* this timeout is added because Pendo allows only one API call per second per visitor */
            setTimeout(() => {
              updateCustomMetadataField(id, targetingCookieValue, user.session);
            }, 2000);
          }

        } else if (GroupsArr?.length === 1) {
          const updatedCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 1]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          dnpValue = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') === -1;
          targetingCookieValue = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') === -1 ? 'NO' : 'YES';
          createVisitorId(firstName, lastName, id, dnpValue, targetingCookieValue, user.session);
        }
      };

    function createVisitorId(firstName, lastName, visitorId, dnpValue, targetingCookieValue, sid) {
      console.log('pendo create visitor');
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/createVisistor', {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify([{
          visitorId,
          values: {
            firstname: firstName,
            lastname: lastName
          }
        }])
      });

      fetch(request)
        .then(async response => {
          if (response.status === 200) {
            callDNP(visitorId, dnpValue, sid);
            setTimeout(() => {
              updateCustomMetadataField(visitorId, targetingCookieValue, sid);
            }, 2000);
          }
        })
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }

    function callDNP(visitorId, dnpValue, sid) {
      const params = {
        'visitorId': visitorId,
        'dnpValue': dnpValue
      };
      console.log('pendo callDNP');
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/dnp', {
        method: 'PUT',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify(params)
      });

      fetch(request)
        .then(async response => {
          if (!dnpValue) {
            window['pendo'] && window['pendo'].startGuides();
            initializePendo();
          } else {
             window['pendo'] && window['pendo'].stopGuides();
          }
        })
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }

    function getHeader(sid) {
      const headers = new Headers();
      headers.append('Content-Type', 'application/json');
      headers.append('SID', sid);
      return headers;
    }

    function initializePendo() {
      console.log('pendo initialize');
      var user = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('userDetails')) || {};
      window.pendo.initialize({
        visitor: {
          id: user.id ? user.id : window['pendo'].get_visitor_id(),
          truid: user.truid,
          email: user.email,
          full_name: user.full_name,
          session: user.session,
          sp: user.sp,
          interface_language: user.lang,
          entitlements: user.entitlements
        },
        account: {
          id: user.customerId,
          name: user.name,
          environment: user.environment
        }
      });
    }

    function updateCustomMetadataField(visitorId, targetingCookieValue, sid) {
      console.log('pendo update Target');
      const params = {
        'targetingCookieValue': targetingCookieValue,
        'visitorId': visitorId,
      };
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/updateMetaData', {
        method: 'PUT',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify(params)
      });

      fetch(request)
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }</script><style>.section-with-left-nav header{display:flex;justify-content:center;margin:0 .9375rem}.section-with-left-nav header _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-101-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-101-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1936-0851&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ACS NANO" data-ta="Sidenav-101-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-101-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 8 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.4133-4156 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec101AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Graphene and graphene-like two-dimensional (2D) materials have attracted much attention due to its extraordinary electronic and optical properties, which accommodate a large potential In optoelectronic applications such as photodetection. However, although much progress has been made, many challenges exist in fundamental and practical aspects hindering graphene and graphene-like 2D materials style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0079-6425&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=PROGRESS IN MATERIALS SCIENCE" data-ta="Sidenav-102-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-102-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 83 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.24-151 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec102AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Silicene, a silicon analogue of graphene, has attracted increasing attention during the past few years. As early as in 1994, the possibility of stage corrugation in the Si analogs of graphite had already been theoretically explored. But there were very few studies on silicene until 2009, when silicene with a low buckled structure was confirmed to be dynamically stable by ab initio calculations.</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-104-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-104-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-104-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-104-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 391 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (6668) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.667-669 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec104AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The desire to use and control photons in a manner analogous to the control of electrons in solids has inspired great interest in such topics as the localization of light, microcavity <mark>quantum</mark> electrodynamics and near-field optics(1-6). A fundamental constraint in manipulating light is the extremely low transmittivity of apertures smaller than the wavelength of the incident photon, While explorin</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1936-0851&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ACS NANO" data-ta="Sidenav-105-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-105-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 9 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (2) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1012-1057 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec105AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Colloidal nanocrystals (NCs, i.e., crystalline nanoparticles) have become an important class of materials with great potential for applications ranging from medicine to electronic and optoelectronic devices. Todays strong research focus on NCs has been prompted by the tremendous progress in their synthesis. Impressively narrow size distributions of just a few percent, rational shape-engineering</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-108-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-108-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2469-9950&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=PHYSICAL REVIEW B" data-ta="Sidenav-108-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-108-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 89 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (23) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec108AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>We report the quasiparticle band gap, excitons, and highly anisotropic optical responses of few-layer black phosphorous (phosphorene). It is shown that these materials exhibit unique many-electron effects; the electronic structures are dispersive essentially along one dimension, leading to particularly enhanced self-energy corrections and excitonic effects. Additionally, within a wide energy ra</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-109-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-109-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1936-0851&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ACS NANO" data-ta="Sidenav-109-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-109-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 6 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (2) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1059-1064 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec109AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>A facile ultrasonic route for the fabrication of graphene <mark>quantum</mark> dots (GQDs) with upconverted emission is presented. The as-prepared GQDs exhibit an excitation-Independent downconversion and upconversion photoluminescent (PL) behavior, and the complex photocatalysts (rutile TiO2/GQD and anatase TiO2/GQD systems) were designed to harness the visible spectrum of sunlight. It is interesting that </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-110-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-110-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-110-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-110-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 461 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7264) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.629-632 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec110AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Laser science has been successful in producing increasingly high-powered, faster and smaller coherent light sources(1-9). Examples of recent advances are microscopic lasers that can reach the diffraction limit, based on photonic crystals(3), metal-clad cavities(4) and nanowires(5-7). However, such lasers are restricted, both in optical mode size and physical device dimension, to being larger th</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-112-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-112-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0935-9648&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-112-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-112-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 30 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (13) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec112AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Recent studies indicate that carbon dots (CDs) can efficiently generate singlet oxygen (O-1(2)) for photodynamic therapy (PDT) of cancer. However, the hypoxic tumor microenvironment and rapid consumption of oxygen in the PDT process will severely limit therapeutic effects of CDs due to the oxygen-dependent PDT. Thus, it is becoming particularly important to develop a novel CD as an in situ tumo</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-113-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-113-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-113-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-113-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 555 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7697) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.497-+ </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec113AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Metal halide perovskites are of great interest for various high-performance optoelectronic applications(1). The ability to tune the perovskite bandgap continuously by modifying the chemical composition opens up applications for perovskites as coloured emitters, in building-integrated photovoltaics, and as components of tandem photovoltaics to increase the power conversion efficiency(2-4). _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-114-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-114-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0021-9517&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF CATALYSIS" data-ta="Sidenav-114-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-114-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 352 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.532-541 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec114AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Photocatalytic reduction of CO2 to solar fuels is an ideal approach to simultaneously solve the global warming and energy crisis issues. Constructing a direct Z-scheme heterojunction is an effective way to overcome the drawbacks of single-component or conventional heterogeneous photocatalysts for photo catalytic CO2 reduction. Here, a novel type of direct Z-scheme g-C3N4/SnS2 heterojunction was</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-115-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-115-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0002-7863&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY" data-ta="Sidenav-115-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-115-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 136 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (23) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.8438-8449 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec115AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>This paper presents a sandwich-structured CdSAu-TiO2 nanorod array as the photoanode in a photoelectrochemical cell (PEC) for hydrogen generation via splitting water. The gold nanoparticles sandwiched between the TiO2 nanorod and the CdS <mark>quantum</mark> dot (QD) layer play a dual role in enhancing the solar-to-chemical energy conversion efficiency. First, the Au nanoparticles serve as an electron relay</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-116-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-116-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1098-0121&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=PHYSICAL REVIEW B" data-ta="Sidenav-116-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-116-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 45 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (23) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.13244-13249 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec116AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>We propose a simple analytic representation of the correlation energy epsilon(c) for a uniform electron gas, as a function of density parameter r(s) and relative spin polarization-zeta. Within the random-phase approximation (RPA), this representation allows for the r(s)-3/4 behavior as r(s)--&gt;infinity. Close agreement with numerical RPA values for epsilon(c)(r(s),0), epsilon(c)(r(s), 1), and th</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1098-0121&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=PHYSICAL REVIEW B" data-ta="Sidenav-117-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-117-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 49 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (20) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.14251-14269 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec117AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>We present ab initio <mark>quantum</mark>-mechanical molecular-dynamics simulations of the liquid-metal-amorphous-semiconductor transition in Ge. Our simulations are based on (a) finite-temperature density-functional theory of the one-electron states, (b) exact energy minimization and hence calculation of the exact Hellmann-Feynman forces after each molecular-dynamics step using preconditioned conjugate-gra</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-118-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-118-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-118-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-118-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 546 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7656) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.124-+ </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec118AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Materials can be transformed from one crystalline phase to another by using an electric field to control ion transfer, in a process that can be harnessed in applications such as batteries(1), smart windows(2) and fuel cells(3). Increasing the number of transferrable ion species and of accessible crystalline phases could in principle greatly enrich material functionality. However, studies have s</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-119-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-119-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1433-7851&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ANGEWANDTE CHEMIE-INTERNATIONAL EDITION" data-ta="Sidenav-119-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-119-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 55 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (32) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.9389-9393 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec119AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Improving the efficiency of electron-hole separation and charge-carrier utilization plays a central role in photocatalysis. Herein, Pt nanoparticles of ca. 3 nm are incorporated inside or supported on a representative metal-organic framework (MOF), UiO-66-NH2, denoted as Pt@UiO-66-NH2 and Pt/UiO-66-NH2, respectively, for photocatalytic hydrogen production via water splitting. Compared with the </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-120-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-120-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1936-0851&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ACS NANO" data-ta="Sidenav-120-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-120-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 8 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (3) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.2541-2547 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec120AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Carbon nanodots (C-dots) synthesized by electrochemical ablation and small molecule carbonization, as well as graphene <mark>quantum</mark> dots (GQDs) fabricated by solvothermally cutting graphene oxide, are three kinds of typical green fluorescence carbon nanomaterials. Insight into the photoluminescence origin in these fluorescent carbon nanomaterials is one of the important matters of current debates. _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-121-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-121-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0306-0012&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=CHEMICAL SOCIETY REVIEWS" data-ta="Sidenav-121-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-121-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 47 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (3) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.982-1021 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec121AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Phosphorene, an emerging two-dimensional material, has received considerable attention due to its layer-controlled direct bandgap, high carrier mobility, negative Poisson's ratio and unique in-plane anisotropy. As cousins of phosphorene, 2D group-VA arsenene, antimonene and bismuthene have also garnered tremendous interest due to their intriguing structures and fascinating electronic properties</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" data-ta="Sidenav-122-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-122-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0926-3373&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=APPLIED CATALYSIS B-ENVIRONMENTAL" data-ta="Sidenav-122-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-122-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 217 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.57-64 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec122AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Optimizing the heterojunction structure of semiconductor photocatalysts is significant for taking full advantage of their abilities for organic molecules degradation. Here, we demonstrate a feasible strategy of polymerizing the <mark>quantum</mark>-thick graphitic carbon nitride (g-C3N4) on to the surface of anatase titanium dioxide (TiO2) nanosheets with exposed {001} facets to form the TiO2@g-C3N4 (TCN) c</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-123-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-123-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0034-6861&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=REVIEWS OF MODERN PHYSICS" data-ta="Sidenav-123-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-123-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 82 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (2) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1539-1592 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec123AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The anomalous Hall effect (AHE) occurs in solids with broken time-reversal symmetry, typically in a ferromagnetic phase, as a consequence of spin-orbit coupling. Experimental and theoretical studies of the AHE are reviewed, focusing on recent developments that have provided a more complete framework for understanding this subtle phenomenon and have, in many instances, replaced controversy by cl</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-124-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-124-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2041-1723&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE COMMUNICATIONS" data-ta="Sidenav-124-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-124-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 5 </span><!----><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec124AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Clinical applications of current photodynamic therapy (PDT) agents are often limited by their low singlet oxygen (O-1(2)) <mark>quantum</mark> yields, as well as by photobleaching and poor biocompatibility. Here we present a new PDT agent based on graphene <mark>quantum</mark> dots (GQDs) that can produce O-1(2) via a multistate sensitization process, resulting in a <mark>quantum</mark> yield of similar to 1.3, the highest reported </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - Expand abstract for this record124">Show more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0935-9648&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-125-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-125-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 25 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (28) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.3820-3839 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec125AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Hydrogen production from solar water splitting has been considered as an ultimate solution to the energy and environmental issues. Over the past few years, graphene has made great contribution to improving the light-driven hydrogen generation performance. This article provides a comprehensive overview of the recent research progress on graphene-based materials for hydrogen evolution from light-</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-126-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-126-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0031-9007&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS" data-ta="Sidenav-126-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-126-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 105 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (13) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec126AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The electronic properties of ultrathin crystals of molybdenum disulfide consisting of N = 1, 2, ..., 6 S-Mo-S monolayers have been investigated by optical spectroscopy. Through characterization by absorption, photoluminescence, and photoconductivity spectroscopy, we trace the effect of <mark>quantum</mark> confinement on the material's electronic structure. With decreasing thickness, the indirect band gap, </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-127-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-127-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1476-1122&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-127-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-127-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 14 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (10) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1020-+ </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec127AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Following the first experimental realization of graphene, other ultrathin materials with unprecedented electronic properties have been explored, with particular attention given to the heavy group-IV elements Si, Ge and Sn. Two-dimensional buckled Si-based silicene has been recently realized by molecular beam epitaxy growth, whereas Ge-based germanene was obtained by molecular beam epitaxy and The as-prepared P-doped g-C3N4 nanosheets show a high visible-light photocatalytic H-2-production activity of 1596 mu mol h(-1) g(-1) and an apparent <mark>quantum</mark> efficiency of 3.56% at 420 nm, representing one of the most highly active metal-</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-130-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-130-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1755-4330&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE CHEMISTRY" data-ta="Sidenav-130-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-130-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 10 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (6) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.638-643 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec130AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Phase control plays an important role in the precise synthesis of inorganic materials, as the phase structure has a profound influence on properties such as conductivity and chemical stability. Phase-controlled preparation has been challenging for the metallic-phase group-VI transition metal dichalcogenides (the transition metals are Mo and W, and the chalcogens are S, Se and Te), which show be</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-132-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-132-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0036-8075&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SCIENCE" data-ta="Sidenav-132-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-132-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 302 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5644) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.419-422 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec132AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>We present a simple and intuitive picture, an electromagnetic analog of molecular orbital theory, that describes the plasmon response of complex nanostructures of arbitrary shape. Our model can be understood as the interaction or "hybridization" of elementary plasmons supported by nanostructures of elementary geometries. As an example, the approach is applied to the important case of a four-lay</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-133-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-133-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-133-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-133-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 574 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7777) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.223-+ </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec133AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>High-entropy alloys are a class of materials that contain five or more elements in near-equiatomic proportions(1,2). Their unconventional compositions and chemical structures hold promise for achieving unprecedented combinations of mechanical properties(3-8). Rational design of such alloys hinges on an understanding of the composition-structure-property relationships in a near-infinite composit</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-134-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-134-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-134-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-134-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 444 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7119) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.597-600 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec134AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The development of artificially structured electromagnetic materials, termed metamaterials, has led to the realization of phenomena that cannot be obtained with natural materials(1). This is especially important for the technologically relevant terahertz ( 1 THz = 10(12) Hz) frequency regime; many materials inherently do not respond to THz radiation, and the tools that are necessary to construc</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-lae-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-135-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-135-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-lae-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1476-1122&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-135-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-135-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-lae-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-lae-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 11 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (2) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.103-113 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec135AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Recent technical advances in the atomic-scale synthesis of oxide heterostructures have provided a fertile new ground for creating novel states at their interfaces. Different symmetry constraints can be used to design structures exhibiting phenomena not found in the bulk constituents. A characteristic feature is the reconstruction of the charge, spin and orbital states at interfaces on the nanom</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span Organic semiconductors and colloidal <mark>quantum</mark> dots are considered the main candidates for this application. However, stumbling blocks in organic lasing(1-4) include intrinsic losses from bimolecular an</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper
